item.title: Palworld Developer Pocketpair Gives Staff the Day Off for Monster Hunter Wilds
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/palworld-pocketpair-monster-hunter-wilds-day-off

Palworld developer Pocketpair has announced that it's giving most of its staff the day off on Friday, and while a concrete reason isn't stated, it's almost certainly because that's the day on which Monster Hunter Wilds comes out.

As spotted by Automaton Media, a notice on the Japanese Pocketpair X account states that the studio's bosses have been receiving "mysterious" messages from staff, who claim they'll be "unwell tomorrow".

Pocketpair then says that because it's expecting a large volume of employees to call in mysteriously sick on Friday, it's decided to give the majority of its staff the day off. However, the studio also says that updates for Palworld and Craftopia will be unaffected by this holiday.

As Automaton points out, Pocketpair actually did the same thing back in 2022 for the Elden Ring release date, so it's clear the studio understands just how badly its staff is going to want to play these massive, time-consuming epics.

It looks like Pocketpair isn't the only one that wants to play Monster Hunter Wilds, either. The game's first open beta, which took place in November, broke Steam records for the franchise, and that's including fully-released games.

If you're not familiar with Monster Hunter Wilds, it's the latest game in the long-running Monster Hunter series of, er, monster-hunting action RPGs.

Taking place in the dusty Forbidden Lands, the game features a greater emphasis on storytelling, as well as the classic epic struggles with giant monsters you've come to know and love from the series.

You'll be able to check out Monster Hunter Wilds for yourself when it launches on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S on February 28th (i.e. tomorrow).

If you want to prepare yourself for the game, you can take a look at its global release timings here, and make sure to read our own Tyler's review to find out what he thought of Wilds.

item.title: Metro Dev 4A Games Rebrands to Reburn and Reveals Brand New PC FPS
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/4a-games-reburn-la-quimera

Metro series developer 4A Games has announced that it's changing its name, and that its next project will be a narrative-led first-person shooter based on an entirely original IP.

Per a press release, 4A Games' new name is Reburn, and it's currently hard at work on La Quimera, a game the studio describes as an "action-packed first-person shoter with a heavy focus on narrative, world design, and characters".

Unlike the Metro series' oppressive subterranean tunnels, La Quimera will take place in "a fictional Latin American megalopolis" and will revolve around a "down-on-their-luck PMC outfit".

Rather impressively, Reburn says it's working with filmmaker Nicolas Winding Refn for the "world and narrative" of La Quimera. Refn is best known for movies like Drive and The Neon Demon, as well as 2008's prison drama Bronson.

The studio promises that the game's world will combine "Latin American folklore with highly advanced weaponry and technology", which, I suppose, is where the title comes from.

You'll be able to play La Quimera in single-player, but if you want to, you can also team up with up to two friends for three-player co-op. Seems a little strange to stop at three, but hey, if it's good enough for Elden Ring Nightreign, it's good enough for La Quimera, I guess.

Reburn says you can expect the same kind of "tense gunplay and intimate storytelling" you're familiar with from the Metro series, as well as "highly detailed environments, characters, and weapons".

It's likely that La Quimera is one of the two AAA titles that 4A Games is apparently working on for its parent company Embracer Group, with the other presumably being the next game in the Metro series. 

Whatever the case may be, La Quimera is slated to arrive on PC via Steam, although it doesn't have a release date yet. No console version appears to be planned for now. Stay tuned for more.
